Every turn you destroy an opponent's land. Every turn you grab a [Wurmcoil Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wurmcoil Engine) or your favorite titan, all colorless.

posts.post_content: Nobody's thought of [Sprouting Thrinax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sprouting Thrinax) into Savra? even Thrinax into [Marsh Flitter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marsh Flitter) wouldn't be too shabby. Really all this card needs is creatures that do cool stuff when they die, like [Summoner's Egg](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Summoner's Egg), or [MindSlicer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=MindSlicer), and/or the legendary dragons. [Kokusho, the Evening Star](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kokusho, the Evening Star) comes to mind, but the others would be good too (Ryusei and Jugan would be in Thinax colors as well)

Posted By: Stray_Dog (5/2/2011 3:37:55 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Aside from how everyone is yelling about the egotist.. you really need to read this card. It's not very good. Remember ooze garden? Sac. a creature, put an equivalent ooze into play, and people found some ways to continously use it or make those oozes bigger.. but like that card, this one has all the same weaknesses and is the same reason it wont see heavy play.
  
   
For starters you can't do this as an instant. It would be best if you could sac a creature to it in the middle of a removal spell, which you can't. Secondly it costs at least 3 mana if you are willing to pay the 2 life, so you are not even playing it until you probably out cmc 4 cost creatures. Following that up, you then need multiples of each type of creature at each cmc to hit them in good numbers. Then you are really replacing the creature you had with another one, and when was the last time any 1 creature dominated a board so much that it won you the game? The days of simic skyswallower are long gone. It will ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Sidneyious (8/8/2011 2:27:44 AM)

posts.post_content:
I might play this in a deck with artifact creatures and [Semblance Anvil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Semblance Anvil),  
so the card can be cast and activated for the first time for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol) and 4 life.  
Then you can get yourself a creature that provides card advantage like [Vedalken Archmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vedalken Archmage), and cast some more stuff for few or no mana thanks to the Anvil. Or something like [Indomitable Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Indomitable Archangel) to protect your artifacts (for future turns only though, since the ability sadly only activates at Sorcery-speed).
posts.html:

so the card can be cast and activated for the first time for and 4 life.

posts.post_content:
If anyone's seen Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica, you'll understand why I want this to happen:  
  
-Using [Birthing Pod](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birthing Pod), turn an [Elvish Visionary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Visionary) into a [Phylactery Lich](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phylactery Lich) using mana produced by an [Alloy Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Alloy Myr) and the payment of 2 life. Use a [Darksteel Relic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Relic) for the phylactery counter.  
-Throw a [Demonic Appetite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demonic Appetite) on [Phylactery Lich](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phylactery Lich).   
-When the time comes that you must sacrifice [Phylactery Lich](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phylactery Lich) (make sure you **never** sacrifice [Alloy Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Alloy Myr)), instead activate [Birthing Pod](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birthing Pod) using mana from a Swamp and the payment of 2 life to turn [Phylactery Lich](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phylactery Lich) into a [Phyrexian Obliterator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Obliterator).   
  
I don't even care that the deck wouldn't be halfway competitive. This must happen. Now.
posts.html:
If anyone's seen Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica, you'll understand why I want this to happen:

-Using Birthing Pod, turn an Elvish Visionary into a Phylactery Lich using mana produced by an Alloy Myr and the payment of 2 life. Use a Darksteel Relic for the phylactery counter.
-Throw a Demonic Appetite on Phylactery Lich.
-When the time comes that you must sacrifice Phylactery Lich (make sure you never sacrifice Alloy Myr), instead activate Birthing Pod using mana from a Swamp and the payment of 2 life to turn Phylactery Lich into a Phyrexian Obliterator.

I don't even care that the deck wouldn't be halfway competitive. This must happen. Now.
